For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # ONE Gas, Inc. (NYSE: OGS) Sell-Side Analysis Report

## Company Overview
ONE Gas, Inc. (OGS) is a leading natural gas utility company headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, primarily operating as a regulated natural gas distributor in the United States. The company serves approximately 2.3 million residential, commercial, industrial, and transportation customers across three states: Oklahoma, Kansas, and Texas. ONE Gas owns and operates one of the largest intrastate natural gas pipeline systems in the U.S., spanning about 20,000 miles of pipelines, enabling efficient distribution from supply basins to end-users.

As a pure-play natural gas local distribution company (LDC), ONE Gas focuses on safe, reliable delivery of natural gas while investing in modernizing its infrastructure to meet growing demand. It generates revenue primarily through regulated rates approved by state utility commissions, with ~90% of earnings derived from distribution operations. The company emphasizes customer growth (adding ~15,000-20,000 customers annually), capital investments (~$600-700M/year), and shareholder returns via a consistent dividend (current yield ~3.2%, 8-year streak of increases). Regulated status provides stable cash flows, low beta (~0.6), and resilience to commodity volatility, positioning OGS as a defensive utility play amid energy transition uncertainties. (Word count: 198)

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of December 6, 2024, via Yahoo Finance/Nasdaq):
- Stock Price: $83.47
- Market Capitalization: $4.68 billion
- 52-Week Range: $73.66 - $88.00
- Dividend Yield: 3.20%
- P/E Ratio (TTM): 19.2x

## Recent Developments
- **Q3 2024 Earnings (Reported November 7, 2024)**: Operating income $107.7 million (up 10.8% YoY from $97.2 million); Net income $28.9 million ($0.49/share, down slightly from $30.4 million/$0.50/share due to higher interest/depreciation); Adjusted EPS $0.86 (beat consensus $0.81). Revenues not disclosed in summary, but margins expanded on cost controls.
- **Raised 2024 Guidance (Nov 7, 2024)**: Full-year adjusted EPS now $3.85-$3.95 (prior $3.70-$3.90; consensus $3.87).
- **Rate Case Wins**: Oklahoma rate settlement approved October 2024 for $48M annual revenue increase (effective Jan 1, 2025); Kansas general rate case filed September 2024 seeking $65M.
- **Infrastructure Milestone**: Completed $50M pipeline replacement project in Texas (Q3 2024).
- **Dividend Declaration**: Q4 2024 dividend of $0.66/share (payable Jan 14, 2025, ex-date Dec 13, 2024).
- **Other News**: Issued $300M senior notes due 2035 at 5.3% (Oct 2024) to fund capex; Moody's affirmed Baa2 rating (stable outlook, Nov 2024).

## Growth Strategy
- **Capex Focus**: $675M planned for 2024 (up from $650M prior), targeting 60% system modernization, 30% customer growth/extensions, 10% safety/tech. 2025 capex guidance $700M.
- **Customer Additions**: Targeting 1-2% annual growth via new housing/commercial developments in Sunbelt markets.
- **Rate Base Expansion**: Aiming for 6-8% CAGR through rate cases and investments; rate base ~$7.5B as of Q3 2024.
- **Efficiency Initiatives**: Digital transformation (AMI meters 70% deployed); renewable nat gas pilots.
- **Long-Term**: 4-6% EPS growth through 2028, supported by 50-60% payout ratio.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds

| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Higher interest rates elevating debt costs (net debt ~$3.5B); milder weather impacting Q3 volumes (-5% YoY); regulatory lag in rate recovery. | Strong rate case momentum ($100M+ approvals pending); customer growth +1.5% YoY; capex execution ahead of plan. |
| **Sector-Wide** | Nat gas price volatility (Henry Hub ~$3.50/MMBtu); competition from electrification/LPG; regulatory scrutiny on emissions. | Rising nat gas demand (EIA forecast +2% U.S. 2025 on LNG exports/data centers); infrastructure bill funding ($1T+ potential); utility decarbonization via RNG/hydrogen blends. |

## Existing Products/Services
- Natural gas distribution to ~2.3M customers (55% residential, 30% commercial, 15% industrial/transport).
- Pipeline transportation services (intrastate).
- Energy efficiency programs (rebates, audits).
- Emergency services and meter operations.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **RNG Expansion**: Partnership pilots for renewable natural gas injection (Kansas/Oklahoma, testing 2025 scale-up).
- **Hydrogen Blending**: Testing up to 5% blends in Texas pipelines (DoE grant-funded, Phase 1 complete Q4 2024).
- **Smart Grid Tech**: Full AMI rollout by 2026 ($100M project); AI leak detection pilots (2024-2025).
- **EV Fueling**: CNG stations for fleets (5 new in Texas 2024).

## Market Share and Forecast
- **Current Market Share**: ~100% monopoly in regulated service territories (Oklahoma Corporation Commission/Kansas/Texas PUC jurisdictions); ~5-7% of U.S. LDC customers (third-largest regulated distributor after SoCalGas/Atmos).
| Metric | Approximation |
|--------|---------------|
| U.S. Nat Gas Customers Share | 6% |
| Intrastate Pipeline Miles Share | 10-12% (largest pure-play) |

- **Forecast**: Stable-to-slight growth (0.5-1% annual market share gain) via territory expansions; no major erosion expected due to regulation. EPS growth 4-6% implies modest share stability vs. peers.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (TTM as of Q3 2024) | OGS | Atmos Energy (ATO) | Spire Inc. (SR) | NW Natural (NWN) |
|----------------------------|-----|---------------------|-----------------|------------------|
| Market Cap | $4.68B | $22.5B | $4.2B | $1.6B |
| Customers (M) | 2.3 | 3.3 | 1.4 | 0.45 |
| 2024 Adj. EPS Guidance | $3.85-3.95 | $6.75-6.85 | $4.50-4.70 | $2.75-2.95 |
| Dividend Yield | 3.2% | 2.3% | 4.1% | 4.8% |
| EV/EBITDA | 12.5x | 14.2x | 11.8x | 10.9x |
| **Edge** | Smaller scale but higher yield; pure nat gas focus | Larger, diversified | Similar size/yield | Smaller, Pacific NW focus |

OGS trades at discount to ATO on growth but premium to SR on execution.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Enable (Enbridge) for RNG supply (MoU Oct 2024); DoE for hydrogen (grant 2023-ongoing).
- **M&A**: None recent; spun off from ONEOK in 2014. Potential bolt-on acquisitions in TX/OK (~$200-500M scale eyed 2025+).
- **Major Clients**: Residential (55%), commercial (e.g., hotels, schools); industrials (manufacturing in OK/KS); transport (fleets like UPS/FedEx CNG users). Potential: Data centers (e.g., Google expansions in KS), LNG export ramps.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: Strong safety record (0.12 serious incidents/100k miles, best-in-class); net-zero by 2050 pledge with Scope 1/2 reductions 20% since 2019.
- **Management**: CEO Robert Martin (since 2014) track record of 5%+ dividend CAGR; aligned incentives (60% performance stock).
- **Risks**: Weather sensitivity (40% earnings vol.); debt/EBITDA 3.8x (comfortable).
- **Online Sentiment**: Positive on Seeking Alpha/Reddit (rate hikes, dividend); analyst consensus "Hold" (7 Buys/9 Holds, avg PT $85).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 7/10 (**Hold with upside to Buy**). Stable utility with dividend reliability, but moderate growth limits aggressive buy. Suits moderate risk (beta 0.6), income/growth blend.
- **Fair Value Estimate**: $92 (10-15% upside). Based on 23x 2025E EPS ($4.10, per consensus) + 3% yield; DCF implies $90-95 assuming 5% capex-driven growth, 7% discount rate. Strong catalysts: Rate approvals, customer adds.
